Release Notes
Version 12.1.0 (12/10/2011)
New

LIMITATIONS 2D
Geometric constraints: Coincidentally, collinear, concentric, parallel, perpendicular, tangent, Horizontal, Vertical, smooth, symmetrical, Equality, Fix.
Dimensional constraints: Aligned, Horizontal, Vertical, angle, radius, diameter
CONSTRAINTBAR command controls the display of 2D glyphs restriction.
Direct Modeling:
The new engine looks Bricsys limitation built 3D models and capture your design intent. This allows powerful 3D editing without the need for modeling history available.
Modeling Direct commands:
DMPUSHPULL: push / pull a face of a solid along its normal direction. When applied to a 2D closed entity that is coplanar with the face of a solid, feature or hole in establishing solid.
DMMOVE: move a solid face, or on the edge in either direction along the UCS XY plane.
DMROTATE: turn a face or a full 3D solid around an axis.
DMEXTRUDE: extruding a flat 2D closed entity to create a 3D solid.
DMREVOLVE: a 2D plane revolve around a closed entity axis to create a 3D solid.
DMFILLET: create a thread in a solid lead.
DMCHAMFER: create a chamfer on a solid advantage.
DMDELETE: Delete an entity or sub-entity.
DMCONSTRAINT3D: placing a restriction in 3D.
DMUPDATE: updating the 3D model according to the limitations specified in 3D.
DMCONSTRAINTSBAR: show / hide the 3D constraints.
Configuring Direct Modeling:
DMRECOGNIZE: This option consists of a series of indicators that determine the characteristics that the design intent (the geometric relationships between the surfaces) must be recognized and held in the direct editing operations and calculation of 3D constraints.
Flags:
Surfaces tangent
Matching planes
Parallel planes
Perpendicular planes
Perpendicular cylinders
Coaxial surfaces
Like Radio
DMAUTOUPDATE: Determines whether to update the 3D model to satisfy the constraints automatically to the limitations of the amendments or the creation of the model. If this option is disabled, the command must be called DMUPDATE to update the model.
Notes:
All commands direct modeling can be applied to selection sets. Down the Control key to select multiple items.
X-based solid modeling in history. By applying directly to the solid modeling with X-solids created, they will lose their history, and therefore no longer be recognized by X-solid command.
QUAD cursor menu
The four cursor menu is an alternative to control editing entities, offering a whole (much) richer editing operations, while requiring fewer clicks without moving the screen with plenty of grip glyphs.
With the Quad-enabled, the selection of an entity and start a command takes a single click. More detailed instructions can be found in the help documentation.
QUADDISPLAY system variables: Determines if the cursor Quad menu is activated.
QuadShowDelay Preference: Specifies how many milliseconds to wait before the quad is displayed when an entity (sub) is highlighted.
QuadHideDelay Preference: Specifies how many milliseconds to wait before the quad is hidden after moving the cursor.
PREVIEWSUBENTS system variables: solid subentities defines what stood out during the preview screening: faces, edges.
Ctrl + LeftMouseButton no longer active real-time orbit, but is used for selection / deselection of entities. This was done to improve the selection of sub-entities (for example, the edges of the solids). Please, use Shift + MiddleMouseButton of the orbit in real time.
Visual Styles:
Display settings in a style called.
Provided however now have a more prominent faces and edges, grips, dynamic.
NEWWIZ Command: 3D option creates a new visual style house model and a view that uses this visual style.
SHADEMODE Command has been adapted to use visual styles, and has been extended to modeling visual style is recommended for 3D modeling, high quality, for representation.
Note: Some settings are not consistent visual style and it shows in the way disabled. Are maintained for compatibility reasons.
Configuring 3D modeling. Enhanced 3D modeling in Bricscad V12, are activated or deactivated by a set of preferences and system variables, both existing and new. All these settings can be edited in the configuration dialog or browse them, or writing a part of its name in the search field at the top of the dialog box. Below are the recommended values ??for these settings. These are the default values, but if you have problems when working in 3D, you might want to check its value:
PREVIEWSUBENTS: set to 3 (see faces and edges) have faces and edges highlighted when the mouse passes over the solids. You can switch between edges and faces out, or completely solid, clicking on the "sub" button in the status bar or by pressing CTRL + F12.
QUADDISPLAY: when you hover the mouse on a flat 2D closed entity or a solid, four cursor menu displayed (see below for more information on the cursor menu of four). You can toggle the display of the quadruple (and use) and off by clicking the 'Quad' in the status bar or by pressing F12.
Commands 2DCONTEXT 3DCONTEXT and change the modeling environment of On and Off.
HATCH: added support for custom models, separate files with the name of the pattern file name patterns.
TRIM: hatch entities can be trimmed. The associativity is maintained whenever possible.
HATCHTOBACK: Sets the drawing order of all entities are incubated in the drawing to show behind all other entities.
TEXTTOFRONT: Sets the drawing order of all text and dimensions in the drawing to show in front of the other entities.
Configuration Page:
create, edit and manage objects page setup.
Page settings can be applied to designs.
Explorer configuration page allows you to copy the settings page of a drawing.
PSETUPIN PSETUPIN and commands offer additional ways to import page setups from other drawings.
SECTIONS:
SECTIONPLANE: create persistent definitions section. Trot (multi-segment) Section planes are not supported yet, but will be added soon.
SECTIONPLANESETTINGS: objects have a configuration section 2D, 3D and live configuration settings section, which are managed in the Drawing Explorer.
SECTIONPLANETOBLOCK: it generates the geometry of 2D or 3D section cut, according to the configuration SECTIONPLANE. The result can be stored in a block or a new drawing.
LIVESECTION: when a section object is "live" intersection objects, fill the intersection and cutting geometry shown in the picture settings according to the Live section. When the section object is moved or modified, the results of the section is updated in real time.

ADT (Architectural Desktop) facilitator
